message.content:
cs.LG, cs.GT, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.IT 

This paper deals with the problem of predicting the actions of an agent in an uncertain environment, which is a common problem in machine learning and game theory. The use of a multi-armed bandit setting and the focus on regret analysis suggest that this paper is most likely to belong to the categories of machine learning (cs.LG) and game theory (cs.GT). Additionally, the use of stochastic distributions and the optimization of actions suggest that this paper may also belong to the categories of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and data structures (cs.DS). Finally, the use of publicly observable costs suggests that this paper may also belong to the category of information theory (cs.IT).
